Ian MacDonald - Code and design
Home
About
Work

Pretty much every freelance site describes themselves and their work the same. They're individuals who create meaningful, user-based design that comes from a passion for solving problems through collaboration.

There's nothing that grand going on here. I like to code, I like to write. I'm willing to sit and do both for hours on end but one pays well and one doesn't.

I have a degree, I've traveled a bunch, I like to read, and none of that really matters. Nobody hires freelancers because they're interesting. Take a look at my work, ask me some questions, or poke around my github. If you feel like I'm a good fit, get at me.

Also, I'm a big fan of the FSF and the OSSM. So feel free to rip apart, open up, use, and abuse anything you find around this site.

  • Things I like lately that you should too
  • Propagating plants
  • Drinking tea
  • Accessibility in web design
  • DAPPS and the Etherium chain
  • This one track
